issue.title: Transifex organization issues
issue.body:
So I've had issues with the transifex organization for a whlie.

A long time ago, the organization where the bitcoin project is under, [bitcoin](https://www.transifex.com/bitcoin/), was created by a person named seone. They gave me and @luke-jr maintainer access to the project, but not full control over the organization.

This means I'm unable to access the [teams](https://www.transifex.com/bitcoin/teams/) page, to make people translation coordinator and such, even though I get a lot of requests to do so.

I've tried to contact seone in different ways but never heard anything back from them. If anyone knows them IRL or by another handle, please help contact them so that they can transfer the organization.

If not, I think the only sane thing to do is moving the translations to the [bitcoincore](https://www.transifex.com/bitcoincore/) organization (for which I have full access to organization settings, and which also has the translations for the bitcoincore.org website) for 0.19.
This will mostly involve updating some links, I expect.

issue.title: [0.17] Release preparations for 0.17.2
issue.body:
Initial preparations for a 0.17.2 release. Needs a look over by laanwj (especially translations). Also need to check that everyone that should be included in the release notes has been included.

#15445 is the last open [0.17.2 milestone](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Apr+milestone%3A0.17.2) tagged PR. I'm not sure that it's a requirement though.

events.body: FWIW 0.19 translations are scheduled to open in a few days (2019-09-01, see #15940), so we'll need a fairly quick decision here.

I think in this case moving the translations somewhere else would be the best thing to do (bitcoincore link returns 404 for me - is the project private?). The sooner this is done, the better.
The fact that there are also translations for the website there makes it even better.

Moving all the translations could be done in less than a day (I can do it), but the issue would be to let the people know we've moved. Apart from updating the links we'd also have to let people know on social media and on the "old" transifex project as well. However, I believe that if some of us make an effort to let people know we moved (and that we need new translators), a lot of new people will join.

Staying on the old project without full access is only going to get worse with time.

> which also has the translations for the bitcoincore.org website

I know this is off-topic, but are the translations for the website synced regularly? If not, it doesn't seem worth it to keep them there.
I have no idea really, maybe @harding knows.
Thursday's meeting decided to "wait one week" while I attempt to ask the company for help. Contacted.
I'm happy to help you guys on behalf of the Transifex team. What username should we add as an admin to the organization?
Fixed — Warren, I've added you as an admin. You can add more admins under https://www.transifex.com/bitcoin/settings/.
Added @laanwj as admin. He can decide to add other admins.
Feel free to message our team at support@transifex.com if you need any similar help in the future, we're here listening. :-)

> Translations for the website are currently submitted via normal PRs, which works for me, so I'm good with dropping them from Transifex.

@harding In case it's helpful, there's a [GitHub integration](https://docs.transifex.com/transifex-github-integrations/github-tx-ui) that allows translators to work online and automatically create pull requests, in case it's of interest. Or simply you can use the command-line client to sync files during the build process or via continuous integration.
Guess we can close this as fixed. @laanwj can follow up if he has any issues with the admin role.
Thank you so much @glezos. That was really fast. It works now.

issue.title: Delete unused transifex project
issue.body:
There is a project on transifex, which is unused according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16754#issuecomment-526373630. Thus, it should be deleted or deactivated to not waste translators time.

https://www.transifex.com/bitcoincore/bitcoincoreorg/dashboard/
